definition: to warm oneself/to expel the cold (TCM)
to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly

sentences.english: This soup helps to enhance blood circulation. It is a winter delicacy that helps to keep our body warm.
sentences.chinese: 此湯行氣活血，特別適合冬天服用，可幫助驅寒保暖。

sentences.english: Rich in vitamin C, the mango helps keep colds away.
sentences.chinese: 它含豐富的維生素C，而且喫芒果有助於驅寒保暖。

sentences.english: Hot chocolate and sweater weather, a good day to stay at home.
sentences.chinese: 很適合宅在家裏，身着毛衣，喝杯熱巧克力驅寒。

sentences.english: I drank some hot chocolate to ward off the cold.
sentences.chinese: 我喝了一點熱巧克力來驅寒。

definition: to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
to nourish one's skin/to maintain a youthful appearance
to moisten the lungs/to make expectoration easy (medicine)
to relieve (cold, rheumatic pain etc)/lit. to dispel pathogenic wind (TCM)
(TCM) to build up one's kidney yang/to boost male sex drive
to refresh and clear the mind (idiom)/invigorating/bracing
medicinal dietary supplement that helps build up one's health
